start:
The Hamlet of Allaglod

Allaglod is a hamlet located in the arid river coast, where the vegetation is thick. Allaglod grew around a calm, coastal bay, and is comprised predominantly of humans. They are a matriarchal feudalist theocratic republic.
Description of Allaglod



Over on Wyaett's Plaza is The Town Square

Further into the residential area is the road Abbott Crescent, where there is The Markets
Nearby is Jovanus's Meat Market

At the bottom of a hill is the lane Spring Lane, and nearby is The Rogue and the Tome

Over on Old Lane is The Old Berth

At the top of a small hill is Jaeremiah Road. Near it is The Grey Station

A side street in the hamlet leads to another, which in turn is the road Common Boulevard. Along it is The Allaglod Haberdashery

At the bottom of a hill is Common Lane. Nearby is Cartus's Cordwainer Shop

Off a junction is Lamb Crescent, where there is The Cheap Beard
town:
Allaglod is located in the arid river coast, where the vegetation is thick. Allaglod grew around a calm, coastal bay. They harvest wheat, and nearby is a region rich with emerald deposits.They are a feudalist theocratic republic. The nearest landmark is a roughly circular depression overgrown with strangely warped vegetation. The very middle is raised and bare rock looking almost like cracked dark glass. A population of 75, the denizens live a poor existence. A tournament is currently taking place.

Government in Allaglod

The people of Allaglod work the land in exchange for working their lord's lands. Affairs are handled by The Consulate of Lords, the head of whom is Ms Alina Holt

Economics

Trade in Allaglod is mostly free, with some taxes applied to goods and services rendered in the city. People live a poor existence because of it. Welfare is average. Citizens can find an education, provided they can pay for it. Healthcare is overtaxed and underfunded, and the government hides behind layers of bureaucracy to dodge complaints.

Law and Order

The policing presence in Allaglod is more of a militia; some of the members of The Officers of Dagger are part time, and there is little need for the use of force outside of intruders. Law in Allaglod is punitive, and those that breach the laws can expect hard labor, incarceration, fines, or, in rare instances, execution. Magic is treated with suspicion, and guards look for any excuse to put a magic user away behind bars.

Racial Demographics
Allaglod is comprised predominantly of humans.

cdb0e2d3-7fea-4aaa-9079-75386311ebb8.name: The Town Square
cdb0e2d3-7fea-4aaa-9079-75386311ebb8.output:
You're in the town square. It's large and bustling, and riddled with refuse. It features small boxes of moonflowers and lavender lining the streets. As you walk through the square, you see an elderly human who is wearing some brilliantly radiant jewellery.
There's a political candidate who is arguing with a man over something. There's also a noticeboard, which has various posters, requests, and announcements tacked to it.

3a0168cd-5704-4d93-ab2b-0ecb16a3df06.name: The Markets
3a0168cd-5704-4d93-ab2b-0ecb16a3df06.output:
You wander through the streets of Allaglod, and come across the market, which is located in a scattered number of tents set randomly throughout town. It seems that the vendors are organised by an intricate and archaic system put down in an ancient civic or religious document. The market is known for cutthroat merchants, and is rather dirty. Today the market is in absolute chaos, and absolutely swamped with people who are pushing and shoving to try to get to the different stalls.

Merchants


Off to the side, a overweight female elf is selling cabbages from a ramshackle storefront.

Off to the side, a built like a wrestler male dwarf is calling "Toffee apples! Who wants some toffee apples? Half price!" from a little push cart.

Nearby, a somewhat short man with nails sharpened to a point is shouting "Sledges for sale! Going fast! Only a moron would ignore these low prices!" from a hammock the vendor has set up.

A light skinned short human is calling "Fancy pavilions! I've got kids to feed, buy it!" from a small, mule-drawn cart.

108e7d0e-909b-4aab-b45a-7418d893e583.name: The Rogue and the Tome
108e7d0e-909b-4aab-b45a-7418d893e583.output:
You make your way through the hamlet of Allaglod until you come to a pub, which is called The Rogue and the Tome, a small shabby wood pub with a grey tiled roof that the locals know best for its magic incense which is constantly burning.

The Tavern


The Rogue and the Tome is very obviously a house that's been converted into a pub, probably as a hobby for the owner. It's unfortunately rather cramped inside, and taller patrons would be at risk of hitting their heads if they were careless inside the tiny wood building. The tavern is absolutely putrid, and is bright and welcoming. A large crude painting of a cat is hung proudly near the bar.
It's peak hour for The Rogue and the Tome and you can tell that the bartender is concerned about a fight breaking out.
A poor farmer is trying to pay his bar tab with a sack of potatoes and a barrel of pickles.
Who else is here?
A poor farmer is trying to pay his bar tab with a sack of potatoes and a barrel of pickles.



The Bar

Behind the counter is who you would assume to be the bartender, a fair skinned rather squat dwarf who is currently taking an order from a customer. You walk up to the bar, and strike up conversation with the man, who introduces himself as Rangfim Battlehammer, the proud owner of The Rogue and the Tome.

Rangfim Battlehammer


Rangfim Battlehammer looks concerned, but seems pleased with the welcome distraction from the patrons, who he tells you are for the most part an honest lot. Rangfim pours himself a drink while you talk with the unbelievably large man about the regular goings on in Allaglod, and The Rogue and the Tome, and Rangfim says "Well, business could be better. We've got a bit of a shortage on silver pieces, and that certainly can't be helping things, but I suppose there's always some bad days; they're just not spending the coin, is all."



On offer today...

There's ales available. The food is standard fare, with roast beef, pork, and mutton on the menu for food, but curiously no vegetables. Rangfim Battlehammer spits when you mention this, and says 'no stinkin' veggies around here. We eat meat and we like it, so if you don't like it, yer not eatin'. The house cheese is 1 Silver 4 Copper and is a white, with a purple rind cheese which is slightly stringy. It smells pungent, as if it was the result of somebody's terrible diet decisions, and tastes somewhat bland.

Tavern Entertainment



Thimble Rig

a white skinned short-ish human's quick hands, a pair of eyes belonging to a quite fat dwarf watching carefully, a deal board, three thimbles, and a pepper-corn sit in the corner, along with a crowd of people watching the two. The game they play around the table with these curious articles is a sort of Lilliputian game at cups and balls; and the beauty of it lies in seeming to place the pepper-corn under one particular thimble, getting the dwarf who is playing to bet that it was there, and then winning her money by showing that it is not.
The middle aged dwarf that was playing says "The object of the game is to guess which thimble the peppercorn is under; sort of like a miniature cup and balls. The current bet is 8 Copper."


Interesting things in The Rogue and the Tome...

You see a noticeboard next to the pub's daub bar. Walking over to it, you see a number of barter requests nailed to the noticeboard; simple things like 'have chook, want grain, have grain, want chook'.

The Rogue and the Tome has just one available room, which is small and quite dirty. Because this pub is priced for destitute patrons, it will cost 6 Copper to stay here for the night.

609454c8-cfe5-4c43-b678-4fc2498a66ee.name: The Old  Berth
609454c8-cfe5-4c43-b678-4fc2498a66ee.output:
You walk down to the docks, which are known best for single handedly keeping the brothels in business. You notice a crew unfurling the sails of their ship as they head for open waters. The docks are large. It has the space and equipment to accommodate a fleet of ships, and is quite tidy, if you can stand the smell. It's currently rather peaceful, the silence only disturbed by the gentle lapping of water against rocks.

78e3a389-ad9f-4d3c-b022-c4f5feaaaf2a.name: The Grey Station
78e3a389-ad9f-4d3c-b022-c4f5feaaaf2a.output:
You make your way down Jaeremiah Road, and enter The Grey Station a shabby daub building with a decently built thatched roof. The Grey Station is known for housing the entire list of laws of the town, codified into stone tablets available for anyone to view in the foyer, signifying that the law is for everyone.
It is run by The Officers of Dagger, who are basically playing dress-ups, with virtually no interest in actual policing.
At the moment, a noble is arguing about some fine which was levied against them- they clearly don't think that it's fair, and after some money exchanges hands, it appears that the fine has been reduced in severity.

Policing

Allaglod is policed by The Officers of Dagger, rather than a separate guard. The guard is underfunded, and their equipment is always in slight disrepair. Their officers are held accountable for their actions when public pressure fors for it, though The Officers of Dagger does not have the funding to perform training exercises.
One can recognise a member of The Officers of Dagger by the maroon and dark turquoise livery adorned with an image of a stallion.

Law in Allaglod

Law in Allaglod is punitive, and those that breach the laws can expect hard labor, incarceration, fines, or, in rare instances, execution.

Chief's Office


The person in charge is Aelisabeth Becker, a weak-willed youthful adult human. This is an immense constable office, but it is squalid and rotting. Parts of the walls have collapsed, and only some of the space is usable. There is no equipment in sight, and the few desks in the rooms are on the verge of collapse.

Evidence Locker

The guardhouse is very tidy. The prisoner cells are in pretty good condition, and quite liveable.

Holding Cell

leader.name: The Consulate of Lords
leader.output:
The Consulate of Lords is a foreigners embassy. It's ancient, and the slightly below average sized faction has an excellent reputation, and is motivated by peace. They are suspected in the disappearance of a well known figure.

Governance


It's ruled by Alina Holt, who was the most charismatic of the group. She is of mild competence, and her position is stable. Bribes are treated as insults.

Members

Members of The Consulate of Lords are identifiable by their orange clothes. Membership requires a bond of kinship, and costs five hundred gold pieces, provided there's an empty slot. The initiation into The Consulate of Lords involves an oath of fealty to their king.


Relationships

Name Race Occupation Relationship
Alina Holt Human Diplomat Head of Faction

Resources

They have limitless resources. A fair few contacts are part of those resources. Also at their disposal are a significant number of artifacts, a handful of favours, a handful of magical trinkets, and barely enough gold.

Politics

The Consulate of Lords have a couple trusted allies;
A guild of priests are the only others they can rely on. The Consulate of Lords have a couple enemies; A guild of commoners are the enemies of The Consulate of Lords.

97895d17-b623-43d3-8cb6-5526ecb9ea48.name: The Purposely Unwashed
97895d17-b623-43d3-8cb6-5526ecb9ea48.output:
The Purposely Unwashed is a monks group. It's recently established, and the slightly below average sized faction has a quite good reputation, and is motivated by politics. They are rumoured to be under investigation.

Governance


It's ruled by Aisiah Butcher, who was able to rise to power through nepotism. He is of mild incompetence, and his position is quite unstable. Bribes will be bargained about.

Members

Members of The Purposely Unwashed are identifiable by their terrible jokes. Membership requires a display of skill, and costs five hundred gold pieces. The initiation into The Purposely Unwashed involves an oath to be taken.


Relationships

Name Race Occupation Relationship
Aisiah Butcher Human Monk Head of Faction

Resources

They have limitless resources. A significant number of magical weapons are part of those resources. Also at their disposal are a drawer of blackmail material, one or two debtors, a handful of artifacts, and one or two valuable trade goods.

Politics

The Purposely Unwashed have a couple trusted allies;
More than a couple assassins are the only others they can rely on. The Purposely Unwashed have a handful of rivals; A large number of artisans and some bandits are the only that wish The Purposely Unwashed ill.

ded2a124-1f0f-4a00-95b2-789dc7e244ec.name: The Common Sense Society
ded2a124-1f0f-4a00-95b2-789dc7e244ec.output:
The Common Sense Society is a commoners union. It's very new, and the tiny faction has an excellent reputation, and is motivated by power. They are rumoured to help lucky commoners.

Governance


It's ruled by a committee of 7, who were the original founders. They are of mild competence, and their positions on the committee are mostly stable. Their meetings are held every day, at 5pm sharp, and are are open to senior members. Bribes to the committee will usually be accepted.

Members

Members of The Common Sense Society are identifiable by the ring that members are given. Membership requires a good deed, and costs three hundred gold pieces, provided there's an empty slot. The initiation into The Common Sense Society involves a pledge.



Resources

They have limitless resources. A significant number of artifacts are jealously guarded, as are a couple pouches of gold, one or two old favours, and a drawer of magic scrolls.

Politics

The Common Sense Society have barely any allies;
A guild of nobles are the only others they can rely on. The Common Sense Society have a handful of rivals; A guild of nobles and a guild of assassins are the only that wish The Common Sense Society ill.

9b89613c-cec4-4e8a-9434-dab7acf74d21.name: The Officers of Dagger
9b89613c-cec4-4e8a-9434-dab7acf74d21.output:
The Officers of Dagger is a guards watch. It's extremely old, and the very small faction has an excellent reputation, and is motivated by money. They are rumoured to help lucky commoners.

Policing

Allaglod is policed by The Officers of Dagger, rather than a separate guard. The guard is underfunded, and their equipment is always in slight disrepair. Their officers are held accountable for their actions when public pressure fors for it, though The Officers of Dagger does not have the funding to perform training exercises.
One can recognise a member of The Officers of Dagger by the maroon and dark turquoise livery adorned with an image of a stallion.

Law in Allaglod

Law in Allaglod is punitive, and those that breach the laws can expect hard labor, incarceration, fines, or, in rare instances, execution.

Governance


It's ruled by Elisybeth Dodd, who was able to rise to power through nepotism. She is of mild incompetence, and her position is somewhat unstable. Bribes will never be accepted, and will be met with instant excommunication.

Members

Members of The Officers of Dagger are identifiable by the ring that members are given. Membership requires a display of bravery, and costs a single gold piece. The initiation into The Officers of Dagger involves an oath to be taken.


Relationships

Name Race Occupation Relationship
Elisybeth Dodd Human Fighter Head of Faction

Resources

They have limitless resources. One or two valuable magical trinkets are in their proverbial warchest, as are one or two contacts, a handful of old favours, a handful of blackmail material, and a handful of gems.

Politics

The Officers of Dagger have barely any allies;
A veritable army of seers are the only others they can rely on. The Officers of Dagger have a couple enemies; A guild of assassins are the enemies of The Officers of Dagger.

8160cd0d-5afd-4473-9592-8801f15f4411.name: Alina Holt
8160cd0d-5afd-4473-9592-8801f15f4411.output:
Alina Holt is a prime adult aged female human. She is short and rather solidly built, and has pale green eyes with pale skin. The most notable physical trait of Alina is that she has terrible posture.

Alina embellishes the truth. When she is relaxed, she is weak-willed. In moments of stress, she becomes spiteful. Religion-wise, Alina is a critical student.

Alina has recently been slightly unsuccessful as a diplomat, with a background of being a noble. She belongs to the nobility social class.

Alina currently has an explosive rune, dealing 2d4 fire damage in her pockets, and 6 Silver 8 Copper to her name.
Alina currently earns 3 Gold 5 Silver 4 Copper per day.

Finances

Type Amount
Gross Income4 Gold 2 Silver 1 Copper
Tax 1 Silver 6 Copper
Net Income3 Gold 5 Silver 4 Copper
Total Lifestyle Expenses (comfortable)3 Gold 2 Silver 6 Copper
Profit 2 Silver 8 Copper


Early Life
I was born at home, and was raised by my extended family as an only child. I had a wealthy upbringing in a village in the middle of the wilderness. I had several friends, and my childhood was generally a happy one.

Becoming a diplomat
